Servlet Metrics Describes a servlet
Servlet Name The name of this configuration.
Parent immediate parent for this MBean
Servlet Path servlet path
Servlet Reload Total Count total number of times the servelet has been reloaded
Servlet Invocation Total Count total number of times the servelet has been invoked.
Servlet Execution Time Average average time all invocations of the servlet have executed since created
Servlet Execution Time Total amount of time all invocations of the servlet has executed since created
Servlet Active Invocations The amount of time executing the servlet during the last interval
Client Processing Time for a Servlet during the Last Period
The amount of time executing the servlet during the last interval
Servlet Current Client Processing Time The amount of time executing the servlet during the last interval
Servlet Invocations Per Second The amount of time executing the servlet during the last interval
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
ServletRuntime ServletPath;ReloadTotalCount;InvocationTotalCount;ExecutionTimeAverage;ExecutionTimeTotal

Name Name of servlet
Application Name Application Name

Work Manager Metrics Monitor Work Managers
Work Manager - Name Name of the Work Manager
Parent immediate parent for this MBean

Work Manager - Pending Request Current Count The number of waiting requests in the queue
Work Manager - Serviced Request Total Count The number of requests that have been processed
Work Manager - Stuck Thread Count The number of threads that are considered stuck on the basis of any stuck thread constraints

All Work Managers This metric gives an aggregated view of all Work Managers

All Work Managers - Active Requests Number of Active Requests for all Work Managers

EJB Pool MetricsPrefinal contains accessor methods for all free pool runtime information for an EJB.
EJB Pool Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent for this MBean
EJB Pool - Beans In Use Count Total number of bean instances currently in use from the free pool
EJB Pool - Idle Beans Count Total number of available bean instances in the free pool

EJB Pool - Miss Total Count Number of times a failed attempt was made to get an instance from the free pool

Parent Immediate parent for this MBean

WebService Metrics Describes the state of a single webservice
Web Service Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent for this MBean
Web Service - Service Name Name of this service.
Web Service - HomePage URL URL from which the home page for this webservice can be retrieved.
Web Service - HomePage Hit Count Number of times, service's home page has been visited since its deployement
Web Service - Malformed Request Count Number of times that this service has received a malformed or otherwise invalid request.
Web Service - WSDL Url URL from which the WSDL for this webservice can be retrieved.
Web Service - WSDL Hit Count Number of times that this service's WSDL has been retrieved

SSL Config Metrics This MBean represents the config of the SSL protocol for version 6.x and version 7.0
SSL Config Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
SSL Config Enabled Indicates whether the SSL port in the SSLMBean is enabled
SSL Config Export Key Lifespan Number of times Server can use an exp. key between a domestic svr and an exp. client before generating a new key
SSL Config Listen Port The TCP/IP port at which the Server listens for SSL connections
SSL Config Key Encrypted No longer used as of WLS 7.0. Specifies whether or not the private key for Server has been encrypted
SSL Config Listen Port Enabled Enables the use of the SSL protocol on a particular WebLogic Server
SSL Config Two Way SSL Enabled Sets the twoWaySSLEnabled attribute of the SSLMBean object
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
SSLConfig Enabled;ExportKeyLifespan;ListenPort;KeyEncrypted;ListenPortEnabled;TwoWaySSLEnabled
JMS Queue Config Metrics This class represents a JMS queue (Point-To-Point) destination for a JMS server.
JMS Queue Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
JMS Queue Messages Maximum The maximum size of a message that will be accepted from producers on this destination
JMS Queue Bytes Maximum The maximum bytes quota (total amount of bytes) that can be stored in this destination
JMS Queue JNDI Name The JNDI name used to look up the destination within the JNDI namespace
JMS Queue Store Enabled Specifies whether the destination supports persistent messaging by using the JMS store specified by the JMS server
JMS Queue Bytes Paging Enabled Specifies whether bytes paging is enabled on the destination for temporarily swapping message bodies
JMS Queue Messages Paging Enabled Specifies whether messages paging is enabled on the destination for temporarily swapping message bodies
JMS Queue Maximum Message Size The maximum size of a message that will be accepted from producers on this destination
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
JMSQueueConfig MessagesMaximum;BytesMaximum;JNDIName;StoreEnabled;BytesPagingEnabled;MessagesPagingEnabled;MaximumMessageSize

JDBC ConnectionPool Name Name of the pool.
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
JDBC ConnectionPool Driver Name Driver Name to connect tot the pool and get an instance
JDBC ConnectionPool Capacity Increment Capacity Increment if any of the pool.
JDBC ConnectionPool Initial Capacity Initial Capacity of the pool.
JDBC ConnectionPool Maximum Capacity Maximum Capacity of the pool (for holding connections)
JDBC ConnectionPool Shrinking Enabled Can the pool shrink to increase the size
JDBC ConnectionPool Shrink Period Minutes Time needed for shrinking
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
JDBCConnectionPoolConfig DriverName;CapacityIncrement;InitialCapacity;MaxCapacity;ShrinkingEnabled;ShrinkPeriodMinutes
WebServer Config Metrics This bean represents the configuration of virtual web server within a weblogic server
WebServer Name The name of this configuration
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
WebServer WAP Enabled Enables WAP
WebServer KeepAlive Enabled Gets the keepAliveEnabled attribute of the WebServerMBean object
WebServer Events Enabled Gets the eventsEnabled attribute of the WebServerMBean object
WebServer Authorization Cookie Enabled Enables use of additional secure AuthCookie to make access to https pages with security constraints
WebServer KeepAlive Secs Number of seconds to maintain HTTP keep-alive before timing out the request

WebServerConfig WAPEnabled;KeepAliveEnabled;EventsEnabled;AuthCookieEnabled;KeepAliveSecs
JMS Consumer Metrics This class is used for monitoring a WebLogic JMS consumer
JMS Consumer Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
JMS Consumer Messages Pending Count Number of messages pending (uncommitted and unacknowledged) by this consumer
JMS Consumer Active Determines if the consumer active.
JMS Consumer Bytes Received Count number of bytes received by this consumer since the last reset.
JMS Consumer Destination Name Destination for this consumer
JMS Consumer Messages Received Count Number of messages received by this consumer since the last reset
JMS Consumer Bytes Pending Count Number of bytes pending (uncommitted and and unacknowledged) by this consumer

JMS Destination Metrics This class is used for monitoring a WebLogic JMS destination (topic or queue).
JMS Destination Name The name of this configuration
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
JMS Destination Messages Current Count Current number of messages in the destination(not include penging mesg)
JMS Destination Messages Received Count Number of messages received in this destination since that reset
JMS Destination Bytes Received Count Number of bytes received in this destination since the last reset
JMS Destination Bytes Current Count Current number of bytes stored in the destination(not include pending bytes)
JMS Destination Consumers Current Count Current number of consumers accessing this destination
JMS Destination Consumers Total Count Total number of consumers accessing this destination since the last reset
JMS Destination Messages Pending Count Number of pending messages in the destination( over and above the current number of message)
JMS Destination Type Returns weblogic.management.configuration.JMSConstants.DESTINATION_TYPE_QUEUE ,The destinationType value
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
JMSDestinationRuntime MessagesCurrentCount;MessagesReceivedCount;BytesReceivedCount;BytesCurrentCount;ConsumersCurrentCount;ConsumersTotalCount;MessagesPendingCount;DestinationType

JMS Server Metrics This class is used for monitoring a WebLogic JMS server.
JMS Server Name The name of this configuration.
Parent Immediate parent of this configuration.
JMS Server - Messages Current Count current number of messages stored on this JMS server(not include the pending messages)

JMS Server - Bytes Received Count Number of bytes received on this JMS server since the last reset
JMS Server - Bytes Current Count Current number of bytes stored on this JMS server(not include pending bytes)
JMS Server - Destinations CurrentCount Current number of destinations for this JMS server
JMS Server - Destinations Total Count number of destinations instantiated on this JMS server since the last reset

JRockit VM Runtime Metrics Exposes runtime data about the JRockit VM that is running on WebLogic Server
JRockit VM Name Name of the JVM
Parent Immediate parent for this MBean
All Processors Average Load Displays a snapshot of the average load of all processors in the host computer
JRockit VM Free Heap Indicates the amount (in bytes) of Java heap memory that is currently free in the Virtual Machine
FreePhysicalMemory Indicates the amount (in bytes) of physical memory that is currently free on the host computer
HeapFreeCurrent current amount of free memory (in bytes) in the JVM heap
HeapSizeCurrent current size (in bytes) of the JVM heap
JvmProcessorLoad JvmProcessorLoad
MaxHeapSize indicates the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) that the VM allocate for java heap.
JRockit - NumberOfDaemonThreads Indicates the number of daemon Java threads currently running in the VM.
JRockit - Number Of Processors Host Computer -- Displays the number of processors on the VM's host computer.
JRockit - TotalHeap Indicates the amount (in bytes) of memory currently allocated to the Virtual Machine's Java heap
JRockit - TotalNumberOfThreads Indicates the number of Java threads (daemon and non-daemon) that are running in the VM.
JRockit - Uptime Indicates the number of milliseconds that the VM had been running.
JRockit - UsedHeap Indicates the amount (in bytes) of Java heap memory that is currently being used by the VM
JRockit - UsedPhysicalMemory Indicates the amount (in bytes) of physical memory that is currently being used on the host computer
JRockit - All Processors Average Load Displays a snapshot of the average load of all processors in the host computer
JRockit - UsedHeap Indicates the amount (in bytes) of Java heap memory that is currently being used by the VM.
JRockit - UsedPhysicalMemory Indicates the amount (in bytes) of physical memory that is currently being used on the host computer
JRockit - Total Heap Indicates the amount (in bytes) of memory currently allocated to the VM's java heap.
JRockit - CPU Usage( % ) Returns a snapshot of the load that the Virutal Machine is placing on all processors in the host computer
MachineName Port UserName password KeyStoreFile version jarpath DISPLAY_NAME
JRockitRuntime AllProcessorsAverageLoad;FreeHeap;FreePhysicalMemory;HeapFreeCurrent;HeapSizeCurrent;JvmProcessorLoad;MaxHeapSize;NumberOfDaemonThreads;NumberOfProcessors;TotalHeap;TotalNumberOfThreads;Uptime;UsedHeap;UsedPhysicalMemory
Domain Policy Metrics a WebLogic Domain is a special target, the Domain target - DOMAINM
Object Name The MBean ObjectName
Name The name of this configuration
Production Mode Enabled Allows users to determine programmatically if the server was started in development or production mode
Administration Port Enabled Indicates whether or not the administration port should be enabled for the domain
Configuration Version The release identifier for the configuration
MachineName Port UserName password DISPLAY_NAME *:Type=Domain,* Name;ProductionModeEnabled;AdministrationPortEnabled;ConfigurationVersion true weblogic.management.configuration.DomainMBean KeyStoreFile version jarpath
Server Policy Metrics This class represents a WebLogic Server
Object Name The MBean ObjectName
Name Name of the server for which the metrics is collected
Native IO Enabled Sets whether or not native I/O should be enabled.
MachineName Port UserName password DISPLAY_NAME *:Type=Server,* Name;NativeIOEnabled; true weblogic.management.configuration.ServerMBean KeyStoreFile version jarpath
